snippet: Chief Justice Shirani Bandaranayake is charged with misusing her position and failing to adequately declare her assets, in a case her supporters say is politically motivated by President Mahinda Rajapaksa.
abstract: Sri Lanka's Parliament has initiated impeachment proceedings against Chief Justice Shirani Bandaranayake, who is charged with, among other things, misusing her position and failing to adequately declare her assets; critics say actions are effort by President Mahinda Rajapaksa to curb independence of judiciary and consolidate her power.
lead_paragraph: Chief Justice Shirani Bandaranayake is charged with misusing her position and failing to adequately declare her assets, in a case her supporters say is politically motivated by President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

headline.seo: Sri Lanka Parliament Tries to Impeach Chief Justice
headline.main: Sri Lanka’s Parliament Tries to Impeach Chief Justice
headline.print_headline: Sri Lanka’s Parliament Tries to Impeach Chief Justice
